meanings.definition: The state or quality of being identical or alike in nature, character, or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The sameness of the twins was striking, as they looked exactly alike.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the sameness of our daily routine, it brings a sense of stability.
meanings.sent3: The sameness of the two cakes made it hard to tell which one was homemade.
meanings.sent4: The sameness of the landscape after the snowfall was like a white blanket covering everything.
meanings.sent5: The sameness of their opinions on the matter made it difficult to have a productive discussion.

meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being the same in substance, structure, or form.
meanings.sent1: The sameness of the ingredients in the recipe is crucial for the dish to turn out right.
meanings.sent2: There is a comforting sameness in the design of these houses, making them feel like home.
meanings.sent3: The sameness of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put them together.
meanings.sent4: The sameness of the melody throughout the song created a sense of unity and coherence.
meanings.sent5: The sameness of the patterns on the fabric gave the room a cohesive look.
